gameplay
Class GameMaster

java.lang.Object
  gameplay.GameMaster

public class GameMaster
extends java.lang.Object

Author:
Geoffrey Long Provides control of the high-level game functions. These functions include initializing the GamePanel, setting the game difficulty, starting the game, running the game, and ending the game.

Field Summary
 javax.swing.Timer explosionTimer
           
 javax.swing.Timer timer

GameMaster(GameSetup gameSetup)
           
 
Method Summary
 void changeDifficulty()
          Changes the speed of the timer and therefore the difficulty of the game.
 void endGame(WinCondition winCond)
          This method stops the timer which stops player movement and therefore the game.
 void endGameConditions(WinCondition winCond)
          This method takes in a win condition and then increments the games played and player wins according to the condition
 void gameStart()
          This method will start the game by creating and starting a timer which will update GameDriver and therefore the GamePanel and game state
 int getGameSpeed()
          Get the game speed
 int getGamesPlayed()
          Get the number of games played
 int getPlayerOneWins()
          Get the number of player one wins
 int getPlayerTwoWins()
          Get the number of player two wins

This method will start the game by creating and starting a timer which will update GameDriver and therefore the GamePanel and game state

endGame

public void endGame(WinCondition winCond)
This method stops the timer which stops player movement and therefore the game.

Parameters:
winCond - The end result of the game, either TIE, PONEWIN, or PTWOWIN
